alert.note: Alert for Henry; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:41PM CDT until June 16 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HENRY...LOUISA AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 641 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cairo, or 7 miles south of Columbus Junction, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Cairo and Virginia Grove Recreation Area around 645 PM CDT. Columbus Junction, Columbus City, Fredonia and Louisa County Fairgrounds around 650 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Wapello, Amber, Grandview, Letts, Flaming Prairie Park, Sand Springs and Snively Access Campground. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
